DataElement.preferredDefinition: the identification or classification of a patient's cancer using data reported by a pathologist.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: the identification or classification of a patient's cancer using data reported by a pathologist.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A specialty concerned with the nature and cause of disease as expressed by changes in cellular or tissue structure and function caused by the disease process. (MSH98)

Concepts.definition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

Property.preferredDefinition: The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the identification or classification of a patient's cancer using data reported by a pathologist.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: A cancer of the blood or bone marrow, such as leukemia or lymphoma.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

A neoplasm that arises from hematopoietic and lymphoid cells. Representative examples include myeloproliferative neoplasms, myelodysplastic syndromes, leukemias, Hodgkin lymphomas, and non-Hodgkin lymphomas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: A cancer of the blood or bone marrow, such as leukemia or lymphoma.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Distinct from Hodgkin lymphoma both morphologically and biologically, non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL) is characterized by the absence of Reed-Sternberg cells, can occur at any age, and usually presents as a localized or generalized lymphadenopathy associated with fever and weight loss. The clinical course varies according to the morphologic type. NHL is clinically classified as indolent, aggressive, or having a variable clinical course. NHL can be of B-or T-/NK-cell lineage.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

A neoplasm that arises from hematopoietic and lymphoid cells. Representative examples include myeloproliferative neoplasms, myelodysplastic syndromes, leukemias, Hodgkin lymphomas, and non-Hodgkin lymphomas.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

Distinct from Hodgkin lymphoma both morphologically and biologically, non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL) is characterized by the absence of Reed-Sternberg cells, can occur at any age, and usually presents as a localized or generalized lymphadenopathy associated with fever and weight loss. The clinical course varies according to the morphologic type. NHL is clinically classified as indolent, aggressive, or having a variable clinical course. NHL can be of B-or T-/NK-cell lineage.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymphoma composed of immature small to medium-sized precursor lymphoid cells (lymphoblasts). It includes the B- and T-cell lymphoblastic lymphoma.

Concepts.definition: A lymphoma composed of immature small to medium-sized precursor lymphoid cells (lymphoblasts). It includes the B- and T-cell lymphoblastic lymphoma.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

DataElement.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
